summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center's daily lieutenant's log for August 9-10, 2019, documenting routine operations and the medical emergency for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, and transported to a hospital.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The inmate (registration number 176318-054) who was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) on the morning of August 10, 2019, triggering a medical emergency response and transport to a local hospital.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The correctional officer who assumed duties as the Morning Watch Operations Lieutenant on August 10, 2019, and documented the log entries, including the medical emergency for inmate Epstein.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The correctional officer who assumed duties as the Day Watch Operations Lieutenant on August 9, 2019, and was relieved of duties by the Evening Watch lieutenant.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The correctional officer who assumed duties as the Evening Watch Operations Lieutenant on August 10, 2019, and was relieved by the Morning Watch lieutenant.

connections.description: The lieutenant was the supervising correctional officer on duty when inmate Epstein was found unresponsive and the medical emergency was declared.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Epstein (176318-054) who was found unresponsive in cell Z06-220. CPR was initiated, 911 was notified, and he was transported via ambulance to a local hospital with CPR continuing.

events.title: Routine Correctional Operations
events.description: Standard daily operations at MCC New York including counts, equipment checks, and the transfer of an inmate to special housing (dry cell).

events.title: Shift Change and Counts
events.description: Routine shift changes and multiple institutional inmate counts conducted throughout the day and night of August 10, 2019.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (176318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York at approximately 6:33 AM on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
CPR was initiated by correctional staff, 911 was notified at 6:35 AM, and an EMS ambulance arrived at 6:43 AM. Epstein was transported to a local hospital at 7:10 AM with CPR still in progress.
The log indicates Epstein was on 'Psych Obs' (psychological observation) with an inmate companion prior to the incident, as noted in the 'Daily Sensitive Information' section.
The document is an official Bureau of Prisons log showing routine operations, counts, and security checks leading up to and including the medical emergency.
The inmate population count changed from 758 to 757 after Epstein's transport to the hospital.
